radiographic_examinations.findings: Small left pleural effusion and moderate dependent and subsegmental atelectasis in the bilateral lower lobes; significant peripancreatic fatty stranding, fluid, and thickening of the left perirenal fascia; hypoenhancement of the pancreatic tail compatible with necrosis; ill-defined focus in the left lower quadrant measuring 5.3 x 1.3 cm, likely representing scarring or fat necrosis; trace amount of fluid in the left lower abdomen tracking to the pelvis; no hydronephrosis or perinephric abnormality.
radiographic_examinations.changes_over_time: Ill-defined focus in the left lower quadrant measuring 5.3 x 1.3 cm is grossly unchanged in appearance from prior study.
